title: Number Info + Vehicle Registration Info Lookup Website (Dark Hacker Theme + Desktop Layout)

requirements.text: Create a single-page website UI with two lookup tools: (1) Number Info lookup and (2) Vehicle Registration Info lookup.

quotes: Make a new website number info and vehicle info

acceptanceCriteria: The UI clearly offers two distinct lookup sections (tabs or segmented panels): “Number Info” and “Vehicle Info”.
Both sections are accessible without authentication.
Each section has an input field, a primary action button to run the lookup, and an area to display results.

requirements.text: Implement the Number Info lookup by calling the provided API endpoint using the user-entered number appended to the `num=` query parameter: https://usesirosint.vercel.app/api/numinfo?key=salaarz&num=
acceptanceCriteria: When the user enters a value and runs the lookup, the app performs an HTTP request to `https://usesirosint.vercel.app/api/numinfo?key=salaarz&num=<USER_INPUT>`.
A loading state is shown while the request is in progress.
On success, the response is rendered in a readable format (pretty-printed JSON or a key/value table).
On failure (network error or non-2xx), a clear English error message is shown and the UI remains usable.

requirements.text: Implement the Vehicle Registration Info lookup by calling the provided API endpoint using the user-entered registration appended to the `reg=` query parameter: https://vehicle-number-info.snipy-owner.workers.dev/?reg=
acceptanceCriteria: When the user enters a value and runs the lookup, the app performs an HTTP request to `https://vehicle-number-info.snipy-owner.workers.dev/?reg=<USER_INPUT>`.
A loading state is shown while the request is in progress.
On success, the response is rendered in a readable format (pretty-printed JSON or a key/value table).
On failure (network error or non-2xx), a clear English error message is shown and the UI remains usable.

requirements.text: Add a responsive, desktop-friendly layout (“desktop mode”) that makes good use of large screens while remaining usable on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths, the layout uses a wider centered container and/or multi-column arrangement to avoid overly stretched text.
On mobile widths, the layout stacks content vertically with comfortable spacing and touch-friendly controls.
No horizontal scrolling is required on common viewport sizes.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent dark “hacker” theme across the UI (dark background, high-contrast text, terminal-inspired accents), with all user-facing text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: The default appearance is a dark theme with high contrast and a coherent, terminal/cyber-inspired visual style.
All labels, buttons, placeholders, errors, and headings are in English.
The theme is applied consistently across both lookup sections (typography, spacing, colors, components).

requirements.text: Use React Query for lookup requests and cache results per query input to avoid unnecessary re-fetching when repeating the same lookup.
acceptanceCriteria: Each lookup uses React Query (or equivalent project-standard query abstraction) with a query key that includes the user input.
Repeating a previously executed lookup shows cached data immediately and only refetches according to standard query behavior (manual refetch or configured stale time).

requirements.text: Add the required generated static images to the project and render them in the UI as part of the hacker-themed design (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
The UI visibly uses the generated images (e.g., subtle background/hero and a small app mark) without routing image serving through the backend.

constraints: Do not modify files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose those components/hooks instead).
Do not introduce additional backend canisters or external databases; keep the app as a simple frontend using the provided public APIs.
nonGoals: User accounts or authentication flows (Internet Identity).
Any third-party integrations beyond the two provided HTTP APIs.
Real-time updates, chat, or push notifications.

required: Dark terminal-style background with subtle grid/noise and green accent glow (hacker-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Minimal cyber/terminal-inspired app icon mark, monochrome green on transparent background (hacker-mark.dim_256x256.png)
